arguments.body:
# Your Daily News Digest (Dec 1, 2025)

## 1️⃣ New exoplanet discovery
*Source:* Nature
[Read article](https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-025-03210-5)
> Astronomers have identified a new Earth‑size exoplanet, **Kepler‑452c b**, orbiting within the habitable zone of a Sun‑like star 1,400 light‑years away. Initial spectroscopic data suggest a possible atmosphere rich in water vapor. The discovery fuels hopes of finding life‑supporting worlds beyond our solar system.

## 2️⃣ Quantum computing breakthrough
*Source:* The Verge
[Read article](https://www.theverge.com/2025/12/01/quantum-computing-breakthrough)
> Researchers at MIT announced a scalable quantum‑computing architecture that reduces error rates by 40 % using topological qubits. The breakthrough could bring practical quantum advantage within the next five years. The team is collaborating with IBM to integrate the design into existing quantum processors.

## 3️⃣ AI startup funding
*Source:* TechCrunch
[Read article](https://techcrunch.com/2025/12/01/ai-startup-raises-50m)
> AI startup **NeuroForge** secured $50 million in Series B funding to accelerate its generative‑AI platform for drug discovery. The round was led by Horizon Ventures, emphasizing the market’s appetite for AI‑driven biotech solutions. NeuroForge plans to expand its research team and launch a beta program later this year.

## 4️⃣ Mars rover new images
*Source:* Nature
[Read article](https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-025-03212-7)
> NASA’s Perseverance rover transmitted ultra‑high‑resolution images of a newly discovered canyon on Mars, revealing layered sedimentary structures. Scientists believe the formation may hold clues about ancient water activity on the planet. The data will be used to select future landing sites for sample‑return missions.

## 🎲 Surprise article – Renewable energy record
*Source:* TechCrunch
[Read article](https://techcrunch.com/2025/12/01/renewable-energy-record)
> Global renewable‑energy installations reached a record 250 GW in 2025, driven by rapid solar and offshore wind deployments. The surge helped cut carbon emissions by 2.3 % compared with 2024. Analysts predict the trend will continue as more governments announce green‑energy incentives.

Enjoy your reading! 🚀
